errors.invalidMinSec: Minutes and seconds must be between 0 and 59
errors.nonZeroTime: Please enter a time greater than 0
errors.nonZeroPace: Please enter a pace greater than 0

trainingCalc.title: Training Calculator
trainingCalc.description: This calculator calculates training pace zones (Easy, Marathon, Threshold, Interval, Repetition, Fast Reps) as percentages of VO₂max (e.g., Easy ≈ 59–74% VO₂max) and heart rate (65–79% HRmax) – based on tables and guidelines from Daniels’ Running Formula.

errors.invalidInput: Please enter a valid distance and a time greater than 0

Easy.title: Easy pace
Easy.description: Easy: easy, recovery runs – help rebuild strength.

Marathon.title: Marathon pace
Marathon.description: Marathon: pace close to your goal marathon pace on race day.

Threshold.title: Threshold pace
Threshold.description: Threshold: sustainable hard effort, around lactate threshold.

Interval.title: Interval pace
Interval.description: Interval: VO₂max intervals – short, intense repeats.

Repetition.title: Repetition pace
Repetition.description: Repetition: speed repetitions – very fast short efforts.

equivalentCalc.title: Equivalent Calculator
equivalentCalc.description: The calculator first converts your time to a VDOT value according to Dr. Daniels' formulas, then uses that value to predict equivalent times for other distances, based on the tables and formulas from Daniels’ Running Formula.

wmaFactor.title: WMA Factor Calculator
wmaFactor.description: WMA Factor calculates your 'age-grading' coefficient based on World Masters Athletics tables and compares your time to world records for your gender and age group.

legends.factor: WMA factor – how much age affects performance (1 = no effect).
legends.ageGradedTime: Age-graded time – what your time would be at age 20–30.
legends.openStandard: Open standard – world record for distance and gender.
legends.ageStandard: Age standard – open standard scaled for your age.
legends.percent: Percent – ratio of age standard to your time.
